name: disinterestedness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of having no personal involvement or receiving no personal advantage, and therefore being free to act fairly: disinterestedness of You are free to question the disinterestedness of my opinions. No challenge to the independence or disinterestedness of the committee members has been mounted.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are not necessarily motivated by pure altruism and disinterestedness.It is clear he had no intention of writing with dispassionate disinterestedness.He emphasizes the importance of impartiality and, in particular, disinterestedness.
